CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 3, 1962, pg. 27, reads: "First Nuptial High Mass in 40 - Years at St. Lawrence - Mr. and Mrs. W. G. Calhoun Jr., cutting cake. - Harris Photo." Article reads: "A nuptial high mass at St. Lawrence Church solemnized by Monsignor Paul E. Campble [Campbell?] and his assistants, united in holy wedlock, Jacqueline Norvel Edmunds and William Guy Calhoun Jr. This was the first nuptial high mass ceremony in 40 years to be held at the church.  The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Isaiah Edmunds and the groom is the son of Mrs. Catherine West and William Guy Calhoun Sr.  Miss Barbara Clem was maid of honor and Francis Grimes, best man.  The church organist was soloist. Immediately following the wedding Mrs. Alice Thompson of 810 Washington Rd., served brunch to the wedding party.  Later the same evening a reception honored the newlyweds given by the groom's mother, at her home, 5136 Hillcrest St.  For the wedding, the bride's mother wore a beautiful costume suit of blue, while the groom's mother wore beige.  The groom is a National Guardsman at Harmarville Base.  The newlyweds will be at home at 810 Washington Road."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of wedding party, from left: best man Francis Grimes, groom William Guy Calhoun Jr., bride Jacqueline Norvel Edmunds Calhoun wearing lace dress with boat neck, and maid of honor Barbara Clem, standing in front of St. Lawrence Church
